main event: Multiple reports detail the sighting of an unconventional aircraft, described as a 'globular shaped object with a trailing tail' and orange-red in color, observed from Sandia Base, Albuquerque, New Mexico, on 17th February 1949.
interesting points: The object was compared in size to about 1/3 of a half-moon in the sky.
Its speed was likened to that of an F-80 jet plane, and it followed a descending course of 35° to 5° with no deviation.
The exhaust trail was described as a blue flame, 4 to 5 times the length of the object.
A witness, M/Sgt John P. Mitchell, mentioned that the object looked like a plane hit by AA fire, gliding out of control on a long angle to earth.
The sighting occurred in clear weather conditions with no clouds and a half-moon in the western zenith.
The report does not mention any photographs of the object.
sighted object: unconventional aircraft (globular shaped object with a trailing tail)
witnesses: M/Sgt John P. Mitchell, 6515th Hq. Co., APSVP
